title: Creating a Discord Server for Community Support
text:
Discord servers are a useful way to connect and support a community. This may be a long-term community (e.g., storing onboarding documents, hosting regular meetups, advertising events) or a transient community (e.g., during a conference or event).
The aim of this document is to provide some guidance on creating a discord server for the purpose of community support. We will assume no prior knowledge of discord.
This is by no means exhaustive and I recommend you do further research on specific topics like permissions before using a server for a major event.


An introduction to Discord
Creating your first server
Channels
Roles
